99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17 (15:13): "The problem is that Nokia claims ownership of some elements of Ogg, which is essentially the file format for the streaming and delivery part of the codec"

99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17 (15:14): Nokia to my knowledge never made such a claim

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:24): There will eventually be a point at which we have enough bandwidth and processing power to store video losslessly at the maximum resolution the human eye can perceive, so this codec thing is only a temporary problem
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:25): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: the total bandwidth needed once we get more and more online would be huge, though
99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17 (15:26): and even then there's the question why anyone would want to be so wasteful with resources
1989c83fcd827071e593796698b07eeb (15:26): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, he could issue a clarification in the next column -- it's not the first time a print article was wrong

b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (15:38): I dislike Christmas; people stop posting so often to mailing lists and I find myself reading slashdot instead
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:52): so I'm thinking that I should provide a setting for filtering out foreign namespaces
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:52): should it filter out tags or the entire subtree rooted at a dropped element?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:53): I'm leaning towards dropping the entire subtree
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:53): (consider foreign metadata elements in <head> or SVG <metadata> and what would happen if only text content were left)
